txt.en: Accompany Girhâzi and Khûldim
<rgb=#00FF00>Think</rgb> about which way to go from the first crossway
'You are quite right that this wall does not look like the others in this mine. Do you truly think it may be a door, though? What do you suppose may open it? This a puzzle indeed!'
Defend yourself from the attackers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Listen to the conversation
'Trouble ahead!'
Defend yourself from the attackers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Girhâzi
'Which way should we go, [placeholder]?'
Talk to Girhâzi
East seems to be the best way to go
'Another crossing.'
Join Amâsu and Girhâzi at the wall
From here the odd wall is to the north
'Which way do we go from here?'

Intrigued by your discovery of a curious wall inside another salt mine tunnel, Amâsu has asked you to escort her there to see it for herself. Girhâzi, who would not want to be left out, is accompanying you.
Observe Girhâzi and Amâsu
\qLook out!'
Observe Girhâzi and Amâsu
'Do you really think the Dubarâkh would be in a salt mine?'
Talk to Girhâzi
'Is that it ahead, [placeholder]?'
<rgb=#00FF00>Think</rgb> about which way to go from the second crossway
'Did you see that?'
'This was not here a second ago!'
Lead Amâsu and Girhâzi to the odd wall

'Níkhu, [placeholder], we found it! I am stunned. I confess there was a part of me that believed it would never be found in my lifetime, and yet, here we are. This is a beautiful treasure trove of knowledge. The culture and history of Ambarûl has been preserved for us in this room. This will restore our sense of identity and help us to rebuild, to uphold our independence. Thank you, [placeholder], you have done our people a great service, and we will never forget it.\n\n'I will place guards here to ensure the safety of Dubarâkh, and you are always welcome to return here, should you desire it.'
Khûldim Umûn has led you into a salt mine where he claims the Dubarâkh is hidden. You should follow Girhâzi and Khûldim.
TBD words here
Talk to Amâsu

'Well this is it, [placeholder]. Hopefully, this pashâg is telling the truth, though I doubt it. We have no other clues to go on, so we must hold on to hope.\n\n'I do not like the idea of being trapped here with no escape. I will leave the Dumûri here to secure our exit. We can handle the Usan-kûni we will likely encounter in these caves.'
Talk to Girhâzi
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. Girhâzi wants to talk to you.
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. You should lead them to the odd wall you found.
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. You should join them at the odd wall.
Talk to Amâsu
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. Amâsu wants to talk to you.
Lead Amâsu and Girhâzi to the odd wall
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more, and have led them to the odd wall you found. You should listen to their conversation.
Defeated attackers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Girhâzi must survive
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more, and have led them to the odd wall you found. You should listen to their conversation.

Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. After leading them to the odd wall you found, they were able to open the secret door, discovering the Dubarâkh. Girhâzi wants to talk to you.
East seems to be the best way to go
Attackers defeated ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Let us go forth!'
'Those usan-kûni are quite large! I am glad to have both you and Girhâzi here with me. Let us move quickly though. This does not seem like a place where we should dally.
'It would make perfect sense.'
Lead Amâsu and Girhâzi to the odd wall
'What caused it to appear?'
'I know not how they would have kept the Dubarâkh so well hidden, though.'
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. You should talk to Amâsu.
'Yes, I see the shape now!'
'Girhâzi, your axe! It is a key!'
From here the odd wall is to the north
'Hold on...'
'Níkhu!'
Talk to Amâsu
'So many scrolls!'
'Bless Írmu!'
'[placeholder], come and speak with me.'
'I cannot believe we have actually found it!'

'Are we almost there [placeholder]? Amâsu wishes to travel quickly, but I believe we should slow down. She will not tell us if the journey is difficult for her. If we are close, I believe we should walk the rest of the way, for her sake.'\n\nYou assure Girhâzi that it is just ahead.
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. You should lead them to the odd wall you found.
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. You should lead them to the odd wall you found.
'It is very cool and dry in here, unlike the outside.'

'That was unexpected, to say the least! Have you been hurt?\n\n'We should leave here before more arrive. I do not know how many members this cult may have, and we are only two. Perhaps we can return later with more warriors to oust these cultists. For now, let us return to Iridír.'

'This is very exciting, [placeholder]. I have not been on an adventure in many years! You should have seen me in my younger days. I was quite rough and tumble!\n\n'Lead on, my dear. Do watch your step though, it seems there are a few usan-kûni in here.'
Khûldim Umûn has led you into a salt mine where he claims the Dubarâkh is hidden. You should talk to Girhâzi.
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. You should lead them to the odd wall you found.
Khûldim Umûn has led you into a salt mine where he claims the Dubarâkh is hidden. You should follow Girhâzi and Khûldim.
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. With Girhâzi's help, you have thwarted an attack by giant scorpions. Amâsu would like to talk to you.
Amâsu and Girhâzi have followed you into the salt mine tunnels once more. You should lead them to the odd wall you found.
Instance: Unlocking History
Explore the mine with Girhâzi
